unit_learning_outcomes.description: Create meaningful intercultural encounters by applying relevant language conventions.
Identify, describe and evaluate a broad range of aspects of Croatian-speaking cultures and societies.
Develop comprehensive intermediate level skills in reading, writing, listening and speaking in the Croatian language.
Demonstrate a refined awareness of language and language use, in both Croatian and in English.
Identify, evaluate and deploy a broad range of grammatical structures of Croatian at intermediate level.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Class preparation includes reading weekly content, listening to the audio recordings, working on/studying vocabulary, doing the exercises in the course materials (textbook and/or workbook), posting questions in the course online forum, study and research time for written assignments and tests.
Online resources include reading and exploring additional unit material provided on the e-learning space that might be required or recommended for completing class activities or assessment tasks.

assessments.description: The written exam is paper-based and has to be taken in Australia. It assesses the content of the whole unit and consists of both closed (e.g. multiple-choice, matching) and open type questions (e.g. filling the gaps, short answer). It also includes reading comprehension and writing section. Only paper dictionaries permitted.
assessments.offerings: Session 2-Weekday-North Ryde, Session 2-exam_att-Exam centre within Australia

assessments.description: Oral Presentation is to be delivered at the end of each session. It can be done in person (on-campus) or online. Students are required to prepare a 5-7 minute speech on a familiar topic in advance. In the second part of the presentation, students will need to answer several simple questions.
This assessment will be delivered in two separate assignments. Students will need to answer a set of questions based on the lecture content covered in class and/or online

This assessment task will be delivered in four separate online quizzes. Quizzes consist of both closed (e.g. multiple-choice, matching) and open type questions (e.g filling the gaps, short answer) and are based on the unit content covered in class and/or delivered online.

It assesses the content of the whole unit and consists of both closed (e.g. multiple-choice, matching) and open type questions (e.g. filling the gaps, short answer). It also includes reading comprehension and writing section. Students will complete their final test online

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Attendance for exam only, Exam centre within Australia
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit aims to enable students to become independent users of the Croatian language. It seeks to develop students' skills in reading, writing, comprehension and speaking in Croatian and further develops students' knowledge of contemporary Croatian culture. The unit aims to develop students' language skills towards B1+ level in the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL).
data.title: I Croatian Studies 4
